program.alert: Only proceed if you have an OK from doctor
program.onlyproceedwithdoctorok: Always follow your doctor’s recommendations. If you have emphysema, get approval from your doctor to use the app.

climb.title: Do you want to improve your asthma?
climb.text:
This is the place for you!
This level is part of Asthma CLIMB, the first clinically-proven program for people with asthma, available on your smartphone!
It includes breathing exercises and videos to help you to:
  1. better manage your asthma symptoms
  2. improve your quality of life
  3. be less limited in your daily activities

Follow the 7 levels in the indicated order and be ready to retake control of your life.
Start now!

program.leavemessage:
If you leave the challenge your progress will be lost.
Do you want to continue?
program.nextexerciseerror: You have to do this exercise in the challenge at least once to unlock it
program.nomoreexercisestoday: This exercise is scheduled for another day. Come back here later!
program.join_dialog_title: You’re about to join one of our challenges
program.joinfirst_error: To start the first exercise you have to join the challenge. Do you wish to continue?

ProgramLoader.program_join_body:
It includes breathing exercises and videos to help you to:

  1. better manage your asthma symptoms
  2. improve your quality of life
  3. be less limited in your daily activities

Follow the 7 levels in the indicated order and be ready to retake control of your life.
Start now!
ProgramLoader.program_join_title: Do you want to improve your asthma? This is the place for you. This level is part of Asthma CLIMB, the first clinically-proven program for people with asthma, available on your smartphone!
ProgramLoader.program_onlyproceedwithdoctorok_cta: Always follow your doctor’s recommendations. If you have emphysema, get approval from your doctor to use the app.

setup.title: Tutorial
setup.description_1:
Close the windows and doors in your
room and sit in a comfortable position.
setup.title_2:
Keep your device
close to your mouth
setup.description_2: Place the arm on a stable surface 20cm from your mouth, and get comfortable.
setup.description_3:
In the next screen we’ll ask you to position your face to fit the canvas.
Also, don’t forget to give us all the permission required for the exercise!
setup.onlyproceedwithdoctorok: Do not proceed during an asthma crisis or if feeling too unwell.
setup.voice_title_1:
Make sure to take
the right position
setup.voice_description_1: Put your device below your chin in a 45° angle, to prevent the air flow from reaching it directly.
setup.voice_title_2:
Keep your device
close to your mouth
setup.voice_description_2: Place the arm on a stable surface 20cm from your mouth, and get comfortable.
setup.voice_description_3:
In the next screen we’ll ask you to position your face to fit the canvas.
Also, don’t forget to give us all the permission required for the exercise!

We’re about to start.
Checking your recording environment.

ml_exercise.stop_hold_phase_desc: Tap Stop when you feel a slight urge to breathe

voice.stop_hold_phase_cta: Tap “Stop” when you finish the exercise

ml_finish.title: Well done!
ml_finish.title_medal_gotzero: It seems you got a zero
ml_finish.hintbox_title_improve: How to get a better score?
ml_finish.hintbox_desc_improve: Please, try to move to a more quite place, watch the tutorial to ensure you are performing the excercise correctly, and try again.
ml_finish.hintbox_desc_zero: Maybe you are in a noisy environment or you have not performed the exercise properly.Please, try to move to a more quite place, watch the tutorial to ensure you are performing the excercise correctly, and try again.
ml_finish.improvewithprogram: Do you want to improve your health?
ml_finish.scoreexplaination:
This score is the result of analysing the breathing sound of your exercise. It is backed by science.
It helps you to track your performance, identifying what you did well, and where to improve.
ml_finish.scoreexplainationdob: The score describes your ability to exhale air quickly and powerfully.
ml_finish.timeScore_desc:
The Time is based on the seconds of each phase of the breathing cycle shown during the exercise (inhale, pause, exhale).
The highest score is achieved if you follow the circle as closely as possible, for example exhaling in the right amount of seconds. If you received a low score means you inhaled or exhaled for too long or not long enough. It is important to respect the Time as each exercise was specially designed to provide health benefits.
Try to focus on the circles and follow them precisely to improve your Time score!
ml_finish.flowScore_desc:
The Flow is related to the amount of air you exhale.
The highest score is achieved if you have a stable flow of air. That is, you exhale the same amount of air per second throughout the exercise. If you received a low score, the amount of air you exhaled in each second changed during the exercise.
Try to make the airflow as stable as possible to improve your Flow score!
ml_finish.cyclesScore_desc:
The Cycles score is related to how many breathing cycles you completed in this exercise. Each breathing cycle is composed of inhalation - hold - exhalation - hold.
The highest score is achieved if you completed all the breathing cycles of the exercise. If you received a low score means you did only some of cycles.
Try to stay focused and avoid interruptions to complete all breathing cycles, and improve this score over the next exercise!
ml_finish.dobscore_description:
The score is based on the pattern of your exhalation through time. For example, the ability to exhale more air in less than a second.

It helps identify your fitness level, and it is correlated with breathing muscle strength, restedness and stamina.

*The Fitness Score is still under development and may not give accurate results every time. We appreciate your support in testing our product.
ml_finish.zeroscore_description:
Here a list of things that you should check before redoing the exercise:

  • Make sure you are recording in a quite environment
  • Watch the video tutorial at the beginning of the exercise, to make sure sure you perform the correct sound
  • Leave the mic's hole free from fingers and other materials


If you keep experiencing a zero value, please e-mail us so that we can investigate.

voice.timeScore_desc:
The Time is based on the seconds of each phase of the breathing cycle shown during the exercise (inhale, pause, exhale).
The highest score is achieved if you follow the circle as closely as possible, for example exhaling in the right amount of seconds. If you received a low score means you inhaled or exhaled for too long or not long enough. It is important to respect the Time as each exercise was specially designed to provide health benefits.
Try to focus on the circles and follow them precisely to improve your Time score!
voice.flowScore_desc:
The Flow is related to the amount of air you exhale.
The highest score is achieved if you have a stable flow of air. That is, you exhale the same amount of air per second throughout the exercise. If you received a low score, the amount of air you exhaled in each second changed during the exercise.
Try to make the airflow as stable as possible to improve your Flow score!
voice.cyclesScore_desc:
The Cycles score is related to how many breathing cycles you completed in this exercise. Each breathing cycle is composed of inhalation - hold - exhalation - hold.
The highest score is achieved if you completed all the breathing cycles of the exercise. If you received a low score means you did only some of cycles.
Try to stay focused and avoid interruptions to complete all breathing cycles, and improve this score over the next exercise!
